name: Goldbug Hot Springs
notes: Popular terraced pools with big views; very busy on weekends.

name: Weir Creek Hot Springs
notes: Short forest hike; riverside pools; can flood at high water.

name: Jerry Johnson Hot Springs
notes: Multiple pools along a creek; seasonal closures sometimes in winter.

name: Kirkham Hot Springs
notes: Very popular roadside hot spring on the Payette River.

name: Bonneville Hot Springs
notes: Forest pools near a campground; nice mix of hot and warm pools.

name: Pine Flat Hot Springs
notes: Cliffside pools above the river; best at moderate flows.

name: Sunbeam Hot Springs
notes: Stone soaking pools built into the Salmon River.

name: Boat Box Hot Spring
notes: Single metal tub; one car can soak at a time; very popular photo spot.

name: Trail Creek Hot Springs
notes: Rock pools with piped hot water; temperatures can be adjusted by moving pipes.

name: Rocky Canyon Hot Springs
notes: Multiple tiered pools across a river crossing; best at low water.

name: Mile-16 (Sugah) Hot Springs
notes: Riverside pools on the Salmon River; can be shallow or washed out in spring.

name: Panther Creek Hot Springs
notes: Small pools above Panther Creek; more quiet than highway springs.

name: Sunflower Hot Springs
notes: Remote riverside pools often accessed via raft trips on the Middle Fork Salmon.

name: Stanley Hot Springs
notes: Longer forest hike; classic backcountry soak; check trail and fire closures.

name: Granite Creek Hot Springs
notes: Pool built at natural spring; rough road in winter; fee charged in season.

name: Kelly Warm Spring
notes: Shallow warm water near Jackson; not as hot as other springs.

name: Astoria Hot Springs (natural area)
notes: Pools along the Snake River; restored facility using natural hot water.

name: Lolo Hot Springs (creek pools)
notes: Small undeveloped pools near Lolo; not the commercial pool.

name: Nimrod Hot Springs
notes: Clear blue warm spring in a cliffside cave; more of a swim than a hot soak.

name: Symes-area creek pools (undeveloped)
notes: Small undeveloped pools near the better-known commercial hot springs.
